page.topic: How do I create a Calculated Field?

description.p: Calculated fields in a Form Design are defined using TPL.
To create a calculated field, you must add TPL to the *[tpl:ON *CHANGED]* event for the field(s) to compute the new value and save it in the field.
Open the TPL Editor for the form that contains the calculated field. Go to *[ui:Advanced Features]* > *[ui:Edit Custom Code]*.

tip.p: Select the *[ui:Yes]* radio button above the *[ui:Edit Custom Code]* link to enable the TPL editor.

description.p: Next, click the *[ui:Changed]* button for the field that is used to compute the value.
Enter TPL in the *[tpl:ON *CHANGED]* function to compute the value and set it in the field:
If the calculated field is computed from multiple controls, repeat the above steps for each field.

figure.title: The 'area' computation is added to the *[tpl:ON *CHANGED]* event for both the 'length' and 'width' fields

description.p: After you have added the TPL to the *[tpl:ON *CHANGED]* field(s) to update the calculated field, click *[ui:Save]* on the left-hand side of the screen to save your changes. Then, click *[ui:Click to save changes]* to upload your changes to the TransForm Cloud.

figure.title: Save changes to the Form Design
Save changes to the TransForm Cloud, making them available in the TransForm Filler App

description.p: Finally, test your form in the TransForm Filler mobile application.
